s.text: Thomas Jefferson Farnham, a New England attorney, wrote in the 1840s, ÒIn a word, the Californians are an imbecile, pusillanimous, race of men, and unfit to control the destinies of that beautiful countryÓ (Weber, 295).
She is a beloved female archetype among contemporary Chicanas, who write poems, short stories, and academic research articles about her.
